protocols.Paper_title: Triton CG-110 as an alternative for cell lysis in manufacturing of adeno-associated virus-based gene therapy
Triton CG-110 as an alternative for cell lysis in manufacturing of adeno-associated virus-based gene therapy
Provenance: Abstract (page 1 snippet provided by user): candidate detergents tested for cell lysis include Triton X-100, Tween 20, Tween 80, n-Dodecyl-β-D-maltoside (DDM), and Triton CG-110.

Figure 4 caption and legend (PDF page 6 of 10 shown): harvest/clarification conditions include Triton X-100, Triton CG-110, and DDM; clarified cell lysate (CCL) generated using these detergents is further purified by affinity chromatography.
Figure 5 caption and legend (PDF page 7 of 10 shown): at-scale clarification and affinity chromatography performed for CCL generated using Triton X-100 and Triton CG-110 (with COHC).

Discussion text (PDF page 8 of 10 shown): explicitly states small-scale lysis tested Tween 20, Tween 80, DDM, and Triton CG-110; notes Tween 20 and Tween 80 were excluded due to high pressure during harvest/clarification.

Conclusion (PDF page 9 of 10 shown): summarizes that Triton CG-110 used with clarification filters achieved comparable performance to Triton X-100 during harvest and subsequent affinity chromatography.
